summary_points: 1. On March 11, 2025, American Tower Corporation priced a registered public offering of $650 million in 4.900% senior unsecured notes due 2030 and $350 million in 5.350% senior unsecured notes due 2035.
2. The net proceeds from the offering are expected to be approximately $988.9 million.
3. American Tower intends to use the net proceeds to repay its 2.400% senior unsecured notes due 2025, repay existing indebtedness, and for general corporate purposes.
1. On March 11, 2025, Las Vegas Sands Corp. appointed Muktesh "Micky" Pant to its Board of Directors and two committees.
2.  The filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3. Mr. Pant's compensation will be described in the company's 2024 proxy statement filed on March 29, 2024.
1. VeriSign, Inc. completed a registered offering of $500 million in 5.250% Senior Notes due 2032 on March 11, 2025.
2. The notes accrue interest at a rate of 5.250% per annum, payable semi-annually, and mature on June 1, 2032.
3. The indenture includes a change of control repurchase event, requiring VeriSign to offer to repurchase the notes at 101% of principal plus accrued interest.
1. Invesco Ltd. reported preliminary assets under management (AUM) of $1,888.6 billion as of February 28, 2025, a 0.7% decrease from the previous month.
2.  Unfavorable market returns decreased AUM by $20 billion in February 2025, while net long-term inflows totaled $6.0 billion.
3. Preliminary average total AUM for the quarter ending February 28, 2025, were $1,888.4 billion.

1. McDonald's Corporation announced changes to its senior management on March 10, 2025, including the appointment of Gillian McDonald as Executive Vice President – Global Chief Restaurant Experience Officer, effective May 1, 2025.

2.  Gillian McDonald will transition from her current role as Executive Vice President – President, International Operated Markets (IOM),  to her new position on or about May 1, 2025,  being replaced by Manuel JM Steijaert.
3. No specific future impacts or risks were detailed in this section of the filing beyond the personnel changes.
1. Axon Enterprise closed a $1.75 billion senior notes offering on March 11, 2025, exceeding the initially announced amount by $250 million.
2.  Net proceeds will fund general corporate purposes, including repurchasing Axon's 0.50% Convertible Senior Notes due 2027 and potential growth/acquisition activities.
3. The senior notes carry a 0.50% interest rate.
1. Oracle's cash and cash equivalents increased by 67% year-over-year to $17.8 billion as of February 28, 2025, driven by operational cash inflows and a $13.9 billion senior notes issuance.
2. A change in the estimated useful life of servers and networking equipment increased Oracle's net income by $442 million for the first nine months of fiscal 2025 (ending February 28, 2025).
3.  A Netherlands privacy class action lawsuit against Oracle is ongoing, with the outcome uncertain despite Oracle believing its defenses are strong (as of March 11, 2025).
1. On February 25, 2025, The Dow Chemical Company issued $1 billion in notes, comprising $400 million in 5.350% notes due 2035 and $600 million in 5.950% notes due 2055.
2.  The offering was completed on March 11, 2025.
3. The offering was made under an existing Indenture dated July 26, 2019, and a legal opinion on the notes' validity was filed as Exhibit 5.1.
1. Workday announced a restructuring plan in February 2025, resulting in an 8% workforce reduction and anticipated charges of $230 million to $250 million.

2.  Despite a 16% year-over-year revenue increase to $8.4 billion in fiscal year 2025, Workday's net income decreased significantly from $1.381 billion in fiscal year 2024 to $526 million in fiscal year 2025.
3. As of March 11, 2025, the final asset and liability allocations for the HiredScore acquisition ($530 million cash purchase in March 2024) remain undetermined.
1. Cindy Reiss-Clark, West Pharmaceutical Services Inc.'s Senior Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer, departed the company on March 7, 2025.
2.  The filing is an 8-K Current Report, indicating a significant event occurred requiring immediate disclosure to the SEC.
3. Aileen Kinsella, Head of Proprietary Product Sales, is temporarily assuming Reiss-Clark's responsibilities.
1. Verisk Analytics, Inc. issued $700,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 5.250% Senior Notes due 2035 on March 6, 2025.
2.  The issuance of the notes includes restrictions on the company's ability to incur liens, engage in sale and leaseback transactions, and consolidate, merge, or transfer assets.
3. The notes are redeemable by the company at a "make-whole" price before December 15, 2034, or at 100% of principal plus accrued interest afterward.
1. On March 10, 2025, Extra Space Storage Inc. completed a $500 million public offering of 5.400% senior notes due 2035, fully guaranteed by the company and certain subsidiaries.
2.  The net proceeds from the offering will be used to repay existing lines of credit and commercial paper, and for general corporate and working capital purposes, including potential acquisitions.

3.  Underwriters and their affiliates hold existing secured and unsecured lines of credit with Extra Space Storage Inc., and will receive a proportionate share of any repaid debt financed by the note offering.
1. Moody's Corporation announced on March 11, 2025, that Caroline Sullivan, Chief Accounting Officer and Corporate Controller, will be departing her position on April 1, 2025.
2. Jason Phillips, who has been with the company since 2003 and served as Assistant Controller from August 2022 to March 2025, will succeed Ms. Sullivan as Chief Accounting Officer and Controller.
3.  No related party transactions between the company and Mr. Phillips were reportable under Item 404(a) of Regulation S-K.
1. Tyler Technologies, Inc.'s CEO, H. Lynn Moore Jr., established a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan on March 6, 2025, to sell up to 42,000 shares of company stock beginning June 10, 2025.
2.  The plan allows for the sale of 5,250 shares per month through January 10, 2026, with a minimum sale price of $575.00 per share.
3. Mr. Moore's trading plan is for personal diversification, tax, and financial planning and will not impact his compliance with Tyler's stock ownership guidelines.
1. Dominion Energy, Inc. issued $800,000,000 of 5.00% Senior Notes due 2030 and $700,000,000 of 5.45% Senior Notes due 2035 on March 6, 2025.

2. The initial public offering prices were 99.894% and 99.694% of the principal amount for the Series A and B notes respectively, while the purchase prices paid by underwriters were 99.294% and 99.044%.

3. The offering was subject to several conditions precedent, including the absence of any stop orders from the SEC and the receipt of legal opinions from both Dominion Energy's and the underwriters' counsel by March 11, 2025.
1. VeriSign Inc. completed a registered offering of $500 million in 5.250% Senior Notes due 2032 on March 11, 2025.
2. Net proceeds from the offering are expected to be approximately $493.3 million, which will be used to repay $500 million in 5.250% Senior Notes due 2025 upon maturity on April 1, 2025.
3.  The offering was underwritten by J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, BofA Securities, Inc., and U.S. Bancorp Investments, Inc.

1. Verizon's Consumer postpaid phone net additions for Q1 2025 are expected to be negatively impacted by a 3-5 basis point increase in churn compared to Q1 2024, and flat to slightly lower gross additions.
2.  Verizon expects full-year 2025 Consumer postpaid phone net additions to exceed 2024 levels, despite the Q1 2025 headwinds, excluding the impact of a second number offering.
3. Recent pricing actions are projected to increase churn by 3-5 basis points in Q1 2025 relative to the same period in 2024.
1. On March 10, 2025, Smurfit Westrock plc appointed Carole L. Brown to its Board of Directors as an independent director, effective March 11, 2025, increasing the Board size from 14 to 15.
2. Dmitri L. Stockton will step down from the Board after the 2025 Annual General Meeting of Shareholders, reducing the Board size back to 14.
3. Ms. Brown's compensation will consist of annual cash retainers and an annual stock grant, as detailed in the company's July 8, 2024 Form 8-K filing.
1. Southwest Airlines lowered its Q1 2025 RASM guidance significantly, from a 5-7% increase to a 2-4% increase, citing weaker-than-expected demand and unforeseen impacts from California wildfires.
2.  Southwest's Q1 2025 CASM-X guidance was revised down to approximately 6%, a considerable improvement from the initially projected 7-9% increase.
3.  Beginning March 2025, Southwest will begin expiring unused flight credits.

1. AES Corp. restated its unaudited quarterly financial information for Q2 and Q3 2024 due to an overstatement of impairment expense related to the sale of its stake in AES Brasil, primarily caused by incomplete data used in fair value estimations.

2. The impairment expense was overstated by approximately $192 million for Q2 2024 and $5 million for Q3 2024; however, this restatement did not affect previously reported full-year 2024 net income, earnings per share, or adjusted EBITDA.

3. As a result of the restatement, AES Corp. reported a material weakness in its internal control over financial reporting in its 2024 Form 10-K filing on March 10, 2025, and described its remediation plan.
1. AES Corp. restated its Q2 and Q3 2024 financial statements due to a material weakness in internal controls, resulting in an overstatement of impairment expense related to the sale of AES Brasil.
2.  AES Corp.'s adjusted EBITDA decreased by $189 million year-over-year in 2024, primarily due to drought conditions and outages in Colombia, and lower margins at the Energy Infrastructure SBU.
3.  AES Corp. initiated a restructuring program in February 2025 to streamline its organization and right-size its development company.

1. News Corp announced a daily buy-back notification on March 11, 2025, reporting the purchase of 21,185,020 Class A shares and 10,452,864 Class B shares for a total consideration of approximately US$646,325,586.10.
2. As of March 10, 2025, News Corp had repurchased approximately US$646,325,586.10 worth of Class A and Class B shares under their US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, announced previously and still ongoing as of March 11, 2025, aims to enhance shareholder value.

1. Rodney Sacks, Monster Beverage Corporation's Co-Chief Executive Officer and Chairman, will resign as Co-CEO effective June 12, 2025, transitioning to sole Chairman until his retirement on December 31, 2026.

2.  During the transition period (July 1, 2025 to December 31, 2026), Mr. Sacks will receive a $900,000 annual base salary, plus annual incentive awards, long-term incentives, and benefits detailed in a separate agreement.
3. Mr. Sacks will continue as a non-employee director until at least the 2027 annual stockholder meeting, or a later date agreed upon with the company and approved by shareholders.

1. Cencora, Inc.'s 2025 Annual Meeting on March 6, 2025, resulted in the election of ten directors, with varying levels of shareholder support ranging from 153,366,924 "For" votes to 168,590,464 "For" votes.

2.  Shareholders approved the advisory vote on executive compensation (156,885,713 For) and the ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as the independent auditor (166,297,099 For), but with significant "Against" votes in both instances.
3.  No information regarding future impacts or risks is provided in this section of the filing.

1. Bank of New York Mellon Corp issued 500,000 depositary shares, each representing a 1/100th interest in a share of its Series J Noncumulative Perpetual Preferred Stock, on March 10, 2025, resulting from an underwriting agreement signed March 3, 2025.
2.  The offering price for each depositary share was $990.00.

3. The ability of the company to pay dividends on its common stock will be subject to restrictions if dividends are not declared and paid on the Series J Preferred Stock for the preceding dividend period.
